title: Microphone Access
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user accesses the Ask At Bat interface for the first time
and dismisses the onboarding message

custom_steps_separated.content: on a device with an OS version of 4.x or 5.x
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken straight to the microphone interface
and the microphone will automatically begin recording

custom_steps_separated.content: on a device with an OS version of 6.x or higher
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is presented with a clear request to access the microphone

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user agrees to provide access to the microphone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should proceed to the microphone interface
where the microphone will immediately begin recording

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user declines to provide access to the microphone
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should proceed directly to the keyboard interface

title: Question Interface
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user accesses the question interface

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 1
and the user is a first time user of the feature
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user first go through onboarding and elect whether or not to provide microphone access to the app

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 2
and the user has provided microphone access
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user should be initially taken to the microphone interface
and the microphone should automatically begin recording

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 3
and the user has declined permissions
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be taken to the keyboard interface

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 4
and the user is not a first time user of the feature
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the question interface will be the first screen displayed 
and the entry interface displayed should be the same as the last entry method used to enter a query

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 5
and has granted permission or declined permission
and taps on the Keyboard button
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is able to enter a text-based question using the on-screen keyboard

title: Question Interface - Microphone Access
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is in the Ask At Bat interface
and provided At Bat access to my microphone and has provided speech recognition access

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on the microphone and begins speaking
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the microphone icon must move to reflect that I am actively dictating

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user is speaking
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the question I am dictating should appear on the screen as text

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user is finished speaking
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the microphone icon must stop moving to reflect that I have finished speaking

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user is finished speaking
custom_steps_separated.expected: then a spinner should indicate the question is being processed

title: Question Interface - No Microphone Access
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user has not provided At Bat access to my microphone

custom_steps_separated.content: and is on the Ask At Bat feature
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user must be taken directly to the text entry interface

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on the microphone interface
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be shown an error message that explains the limitations of the feature without those permissions and presents a link to manage permissions

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on the link to manage permissions on the error message from step 2
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken into At Bat settings in the Android Settings to enable microphone access

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on "Use Keyboard" from the error message from step 2
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be returned to the text entry interface

title: Question Interface - Valid Question

title: Team vs Individual Stats_SDBB-340
custom_preconds: GIVEN the bot needs to be able to discern better between team and individual when discussing teams

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is asking for the stat leaders on a given team

i.e. 
1. Who on the Yankees has the most home runs?
2. What Yankee has the most home runs?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is grouped by Individual
AND player image is displayed

i.e. 
1. Deeplink: mlbatbat://stats?stat_type=hitting&stat=hr&team_id=147
2. Deeplink: mlbatbat://stats?stat_type=hitting&stat=hr&team_id=147

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is asking for the team's aggregate numbers for a stat

i.e. How many home runs do the Yankees have
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is grouped by Team

i.e. Deeplink: mlbatbat://stats?stat_type=hitting&stat=hr&section=team

title: Utterance - Group By
custom_steps: When the user utters variables of the parameter for 'group by'
custom_expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested stat for each variable

custom_steps_separated.content:
- What team has the most hits?
- What organization has the most hits?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested team stat

title: EDIT_Utterance - Game Type
custom_steps: When the user utters variables of the parameter for 'Game Type'
custom_expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested stat for each variable

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the regular season?
- Who has the most hits this season?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested regular season stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the postseason?
- Who has the most hits in the playoffs?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested postseason stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the wild card game?
- Who has the most hits in the wild card?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with the requested F , AL, or NL stat

NOTE: 
At Bat does not support stats by individual matchup in the playoffs (i.e., ALDS Team A. vs. Team B). If the user provides a league, that can be included in the response and would cover all AL or NL teams that played in the round (i.e., 4 teams in the ALDS, 2 teams in the ALCS).

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the division series?
- Who has the most hits in the ds?
- Who has the most hits in the alds?
- Who has the most hits in the nlds?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with the requested D , AL, or NL stat

NOTE: 
At Bat does not support stats by individual matchup in the playoffs (i.e., ALDS Team A. vs. Team B). If the user provides a league, that can be included in the response and would cover all AL or NL teams that played in the round (i.e., 4 teams in the ALDS, 2 teams in the ALCS).

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the championship series?
- Who has the most hits in the cs?
- Who has the most hits in the alcs?
- Who has the most hits in the nlcs?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with the requested L , AL, or NL stat

NOTE:
At Bat does not support stats by individual matchup in the playoffs (i.e., ALDS Team A. vs. Team B). If the user provides a league, that can be included in the response and would cover all AL or NL teams that played in the round (i.e., 4 teams in the ALDS, 2 teams in the ALCS).

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the world series?
- Who has the most hits in the fall classic?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with the requested world series stat

NOTE: No need to define AL or NL here. MLB (the default) is assumed.

title: Team Update, Team Name misinterpreted

GIVEN the user is in At Bat app
AND is in the questions interface of Ask At Bat
AND the user makes a valid request

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user makes a team update request
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team name should not be misinterpreted by the bot and should respond with the correct team info
AND the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

i.e. User requests "Red Sox" so Bot should respond with "Red Sox" response, not "White Sox" response

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user makes a team update request with phatic info (in this instance phatic means anything unrelated to baseball)
AND the team name is misinterpreted by the bot

i.e. Tiggers (instead of Tigers)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN if product decides to treat "Tiggers" as "phatic"* speech, then the bot is expected to respond to "Tiggers" by saying "Bouncing is what they do best", or "huh?"

However, our bot will likely spell-check Tiggers -> Tigers, and treat it as a request for the Tigers team
AND the bot returns a team page deep link for the requested team
AND the user is taken to the team page in At Bat of the requested team

title: For Fun
custom_preconds:
Old Hoss Radbourn, he’s a pitcher from the 19th century and now he lives on as a Twitter account written by someone who’s very funny — has a lot of followers. The general gist being that baseball players today are all wimps compared to — most especially — pitchers of the 19th century that threw 500 innings a season.

GIVEN user is in At Bat
AND is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user posses the following query:

Who is the most dapper hurler to ever play the old ball game?
custom_expected:
THEN the response is:

“There are many schools of thought, but lately I lean towards Old Hoss Radbourn and his 489 complete games.”
